summary: The document, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, details a communication from December 2, 1963, about Jack RUBENSTEIN. RUBENSTEIN traveled to Israel in 1962, claiming Polish origin, born in 1905, and a New York resident, accompanied by his wife Mimi during his stay from May 17 to June 7.
key_findings: The document is part of the records related to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
It mentions an individual named Jack RUBENSTEIN with details about his travel to Israel in 1962.
The communication suggests an interest in tracking or verifying the movements of individuals possibly connected to the assassination.
